intro: Taraxacum theodori, commonly known as the Theodore's dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant features basal rosettes of lanceolate, hairy leaves and produces a hollow, elongated stem that supports a single flower head. Its yellow花朵 are surrounded by a pappus of bristles, aiding in wind pollination and seed dispersal. The species is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides.
